articles.title: More than stage, I miss backstage: Rasika Dugal on World Theatre Day
articles.description: Actress Rasika Dugal on Sunday shared pictures of herself on stage on Instagram to celebrate World Theatre Day. She wrote, "The heart still thumps at the sound of the third bell. More than being on stage I miss the backstage. Hurried whispers, fluttering frenzy and racing hearts." Rasika has been a part of plays like 'The Vagina Monologues' and 'Dastangoi'.

articles.title: Not scared of being stereotyped as a small-town girl in films: Bhumi
articles.description: Actress Bhumi Pednekar said she's not scared of being stereotyped as a small-town girl in films. "I don't think representing 70% of the country can stereotype me," she stated. "I want to represent them (small-town girls)...would love to be a part of stories that represent them," she added. Bhumi also said that repetition is what scares her as an actress.

articles.title: Talks with Pak on Kashmir only when there's no sound of guns: Singh
articles.description: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Sunday reacted to Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti's demand of BJP holding talks with Pakistan, stating that dialogue's only possible when there's no sound of guns or bullets. "Would BJP talk to people of [India] or [foreigners]?" he added. Mufti had said BJP should hold talks with Pakistan to ensure peace in Kashmir.

articles.title: Salman Khan congratulated me for 'The Kashmir Files': Anupam Kher
articles.description: Veteran actor Anupam Kher has revealed that actor Salman Khan called him a few days ago and congratulated him about the success of his film 'The Kashmir Files'. "As far as the Hindi film industry is concerned, I think they are too much in a shock," the actor added. Anupam further said that it is a "very very strange reaction".

articles.title: Your fee in OTT increases if you've done films: Sonnalli Seygall
articles.description: Actress Sonnalli Seygall has said that an actor's fee in OTT projects increases if they have done films. "Had I not done films and if I had done OTT, probably I wouldn't have been compensated as much as I am getting now," Sonnalli added. She further added that OTT platforms have increased the amount of work an actor gets.

articles.title: Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani like Kuch Kuch Hota Hai: Karan Johar
articles.description: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that he is tapping into the quintessential Bollywood movie genre with his upcoming film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. He added that he is going into the world of his 1998 film 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'. "We are...trying...to...cross cinematic boundaries...But then we have also forgotten that there was an innocence and purity," Karan said.

articles.title: Allow jawans who cleared UPSC to join civil services: Court to IAF
articles.description: Armed Forces Tribunal has asked Indian Air Force to let the jawans, who had cleared UPSC civil services examinations, join civil services within two weeks. One of the petitioners had approached the Tribunal after he wasn't given a No Objection Certificate by IAF. Tribunal asked Air Force to change rules for granting permission for applying for grade 'A' services exams.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea shareholders approve ₹14,500 crore fundraise proposal
articles.description: Shareholders of Vodafone Idea (Vi) have approved a proposal to raise ₹14,500 crore, the telecom operator said in a filing on Saturday. Promoters Vodafone and Aditya Birla Group (ABG) plan to infuse up to ₹3,375 crore and ₹1,125 crore into Vi respectively. While Vodafone will subscribe to 75% or 253.75 crore equity shares, ABG will subscribe to 84.58 crore shares.

articles.title: It's disappointing: England batting coach on team's performance vs WI
articles.description: England batting coach Marcus Trescothick said that the team's performance on Day 3 in the third Test against West Indies has been disappointing. "We've not got it right in both departments," the batting coach added. This comes after England were down to 103/8 with a lead of 10 runs in the second innings at stumps on Day 3.

articles.title: India-UAE trade pact may come into force from May 1: Piyush Goyal
articles.description: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and the UAE is likely to come into effect from May 1. Under the agreement, domestic exporters of 6,090 goods would get duty-free access to the UAE market, Goyal added. Overall, the UAE is offering duty elimination on over 97% of its products.

articles.title: Committed to service, not telling people what to do: Prince William
articles.description: UK's Prince William has said that he and his wife are committed to service and "not telling people what to do" after their eight-day trip to Caribbean nations concluded. "In Belize, Jamaica and The Bahamas, that future is for...people to decide upon," he added. Prince William's remarks came after Jamaican PM told royals that Jamaica wants to be "independent" country.

articles.title: Scientists develop theory to understand the heat around Sun's corona
articles.description: Scientists from New Zealand's University of Otago have developed a new, unified theory to understand the heat around Sun's upper atmosphere or corona. The team said the sudden jump in temperatures is due to the magnetic fields which thread out of the Sun's surface. "The solar corona's dynamics can have profound impacts on Earth," study co-author Dr Romain Meyrand said.

articles.title: Mahesh Babu's National Award-winning 'Maharshi' screened at Dubai Expo 2020
articles.description: National Award-winning 2019 Telugu film 'Maharshi', which stars Mahesh Babu, was screened at the India Pavillion of Dubai Expo 2020 on Saturday. The screening was scheduled on the occasion of Media & Entertainment Fortnight. The Vamshi Paidipally directorial had won two National Awards in the Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment and Best Choreography categories.

articles.title: AAP MP Raghav Chadha walks the ramp as showstopper at Lakme Fashion week
articles.description: Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha on Sunday walked the ramp as showstopper for designer Pawan Sachdev at the Lakme Fashion Week 2022. The 33-year-old, who was recently nominated by the party for the Rajya Sabha polls, is the youngest member of the Upper House. A video showed Raghav walking the ramp with the designer and actor Aparshakti Khurana.

articles.title: Looking into it: Musk as man shares pic of vandalised 'expensive, beloved' Tesla
articles.description: Tesla CEO and the world's richest man, Elon Musk, tweeted "Looking into it" to a man who had shared a picture of his Tesla car that was vandalised in Israel. The man urged Musk to enable 'sentry mode' in Israel to keep "expensive and beloved" Tesla cars safe. Tesla's sentry mode uses the car's external cameras to detect potential threats.

articles.title: Vivek Agnihotri's foundation announces ₹15 lakh scholarship for 5 students
articles.description: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri and his wife actress Pallavi Joshi's I Am Buddha Foundation has announced a scholarship of ₹15 lakh each to five students of Bhopal's Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University of Journalism and Communication. Out of the five, three scholarships will be given to female students. The foundation had earlier raised funds for the Kashmiri community during COVID-19.

articles.title: India to start building 10 nuclear reactors in 'fleet mode' from 2023
articles.description: India will begin construction of 10 nuclear reactors in 'fleet mode' over the next three years from 2023, officials said. The first pour of concrete (FPC) for a 700 MW atomic plant in Karnataka is scheduled for 2023. Under the fleet mode, a nuclear power plant is expected to be built over a period of five years from the FPC.

articles.title: Grateful to have you by my side: Jr NTR wishes Ram Charan on b’day
articles.description: Actor Jr NTR, taking to Twitter, wished his 'RRR' co-star Ram Charan on his 37th birthday. "Many happy returns brother Ram. Always grateful to have you by my side. Here's to making many more memories together," Jr NTR wrote. On Saturday night, Jr NTR also threw a party for Ram at his residence. 'RRR' is directed by SS Rajamouli.

articles.title: More than 16,000 Russian troops killed since war began: Ukraine
articles.description: Ukrainian Foreign Ministry on Sunday said nearly 16,600 Russian military personnel have been killed since war began on February 24. As per the ministry, 121 aircraft, 127 helicopters and 582 tanks belonging to the Russian military have been destroyed so far. This comes a day after Russia claimed that it lost 1,351 soldiers during the special operation in Ukraine.

articles.title: UN chief condemns strikes on civilian areas in Saudi Arabia, Yemen
articles.description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Saturday condemned attacks on civilian facilities in Saudi Arabia and Yemen. "The Secretary-General is deeply concerned about reports of ongoing airstrikes in Hodeidah city..." said Stéphane Dujarric, spokesperson for the Secretary-General. This comes after Saudi led coalition launched a barrage of airstrikes in Yemen's Sanaa and Hodeidah on Saturday.

articles.title: Bihar CM attacked by man at function in his hometown, video surfaces
articles.description: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar was attacked by a man during a function in his hometown Bakhtiyarpur on Sunday. Footage from CCTV cameras showed the man climbing the stage and hitting Kumar from behind before security personnel caught hold of him. As per reports, the man is believed to be a local and has been arrested.

articles.title: Shed ego, attend exams: K'taka Minister to students on hijab row
articles.description: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh on Sunday appealed to the students, who are insisting on wearing the hijab, to "shed their ego" and attend the Class 10 examination, which will begin on March 28. He further said that the students wearing the hijab or any other religious attire wouldn't be allowed to enter the examination hall.

articles.title: Qatar, Gates Foundation to invest up to $200 mn on green agriculture
articles.description: Gates Foundation on Sunday said the organisation and Qatar will jointly invest up to $200 million to introduce climate-adaptive farming methods to developing countries. "We are trying to help those communities grapple with the reality of climate change..." said Gates Foundation CEO Mark Suzman. The partnership aims to provide aid to agriculture-dependent communities mainly in sub-Saharan Africa.

articles.title: Second black box of crashed Chinese passenger jet found
articles.description: The second black box of the China Eastern Airlines plane that crashed on Monday has been found, Chinese state media reported on Sunday. The two recorders will help investigators determine what caused the plane to crash into a forested mountainside. The plane crash had left all 132 people on board the plane dead.

articles.title: Will protest if CBI follows BJP's directions in Birbhum: Mamata
articles.description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday alleged that there was a conspiracy behind the Birbhum violence, in which at least eight people were killed. She said, "If [CBI] will only follow BJP's directions, we are ready to protest." The CBI is probing the case and a 15-member team of the agency visited the Bogtui village on Saturday.

articles.title: BJP & RSS spread propaganda, won't accept President's post : Mayawati
articles.description: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati on Sunday alleged that BJP and RSS spread "false propaganda" that she would be made President of the country if BJP won the Uttar Pradesh polls. Mayawati further said that she won't accept an offer for President's post from BJP or any party because it would be the "end" of the BSP party.

articles.title: 12-yr-old girl raped by 25-yr-old cousin in UP, arrested
articles.description: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 25-year-old cousin in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district, police said on Sunday. The incident took place on Friday when the accused visited her house and found her alone, police added. He then took her to a secluded spot and raped her, following which he was arrested on Saturday night.

articles.title: TV gets repetitive, what new can you show after a year: Sonarika
articles.description: Actress Sonarika Bhadoria has stated that she doesn't take up much work on television because it gets monotonous. "TV gets repetitive. After one year, what new can you show in the same story? There's only so much you can do," she added. The actress further said that there is a supply of television shows because there is a demand.

articles.title: Result was heartbreaking, you fought till end: Anushka to women's team on WC loss
articles.description: After India crashed out of the 2022 Women's World Cup, actress Anushka Sharma said, "The result did not go our way and was heartbreaking." She added, "What an exciting, enthralling match you fought right till the end girls. You will always have our never-ending support and belief." India lost the match against South Africa by three wickets.

articles.title: World cannot burn bridges with Russia: Turkey amid Ukraine crisis
articles.description: Turkey's Presidential Spokesperson Ibrahim Kalin said on Sunday that countries must continue dialogue with Russia and not "burn bridges" with it to help end war in Ukraine. "Ukrainians need to be supported...so they can defend themselves...but the Russian case must be heard," Kalin added. Turkey, which is a NATO member country, has sought to mediate in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

articles.title: Jeweller Joyalukkas files for ₹2,300 crore IPO
articles.description: Jeweller Joyalukkas plans to raise up to ₹2,300 crore from an initial public offering (IPO), the company said in a draft prospectus. The proceeds will be used to pay back some loans and to open new stores, Joyalukkas said. Edelweiss Financial Services, Haitong Securities India, Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors and SBI Capital Markets are the lead managers to the issue.

articles.title: 20,000 street children identified, in process of rehabilitation: NCPCR
articles.description: Around 20,000 street children have been identified across the country and are in the process of getting rehabilitated, according to National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) Chairperson Priyank Kanoongo. "States are not working as effectively as they must be," he said. Kanoongo further said that Madhya Pradesh and some areas of West Bengal have done good work.

articles.title: Pakistan logs 310 new COVID-19 cases, 5 deaths in last 24 hours
articles.description: Pakistani authorities on Sunday reported 310 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 5 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to 30,345. NCOC added that positivity rate jumped up to 0.96% from 0.62% in same period. Meanwhile, with over 5.7 lakh cases, Sindh remains the worst hit province.

articles.title: Amarnath Yatra in J&K to commence on June 30 after 2-year gap
articles.description: The Amarnath Yatra this year will commence on June 30 and conclude on the day of Raksha Bandhan, office of Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has said. The pilgrimage will be held for 43 days and in compliance with COVID-19 protocols. The yatra had been suspended in 2020 and 2021 due to the pandemic.

articles.title: Russia wants to split Ukraine like North and South Korea: Official
articles.description: Russia is trying to split Ukraine just as Korea was divided into the North and the South after World War II, Ukraine's Defence Intelligence chief Kyrylo Budanov said. Notably, the leader of Luhansk People's Republic, one of Ukraine's breakaway regions, said that the region could soon hold a referendum on joining Russia. In 2014, Russia had annexed Crimea from Ukraine.

articles.title: RCB, PBKS announce their playing XIs for their first match of IPL 2022
articles.description: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to field first against RCB in their first match of IPL 2022. RCB's foreign players in the playing XI include captain Faf du Plessis, Sherfane Rutherford, Wanindu Hasaranga and David Willey. Meanwhile, PBKS' overseas players include Liam Livingstone, Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Odean Smith.

articles.title: Peru's Machu Picchu called by wrong name for over 100 years: Study
articles.description: Peruvian historian, Donato Amado Gonzales and US archaeologist Brian Bauer said that the world heritage site of Machu Picchu in Peru has been called by wrong name for over 100 years. The duo researched and reviewed documents, maps and records by US explorer Hiram Bingham and found that the actual name of the ancient Inca site is Huayna Picchu.

articles.title: Getting ready for 'Mahabharat' shoot took 1.5 hours: Roopa Ganguly
articles.description: Actress-turned-politician Roopa Ganguly, who portrayed Draupadi in the television series 'Mahabharat', has stated that it took her at least an hour and a half every day to get ready. She added that shooting started at 7AM and she was in make-up at 5AM. Roopa further said she didn't get to watch it on television due to the hectic shooting schedule.

articles.title: DC chase down 178-run target as MI lose their opening match in IPL for 10 years in a row
articles.description: Delhi Capitals (DC) chased down 178-run target in 18.2 overs against five-time champions Mumbai Indians (MI) in their opening match of IPL 2022.  This is the tenth consecutive time that Mumbai Indians have lost their opening match in the IPL. Lalit Yadav top-scored for DC with 48*(38), while DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav registered bowling figures of 4-0-18-3.

articles.title: Hyd Police begins special drive against number plate tampering
articles.description: Hyderabad Traffic Police started a special drive against violations of the Motor Vehicles Act and Rules. The drive involved issues concerning number plate tampering, fixing of irregular number plates, moving without a plate, having temporary registration plates even after a month of purchase, horns, silencers and safety glasses. Cases were filed against violators during a recent drive.

articles.title: Give account of ₹26 lakh cr tax earned on petrol, diesel: Cong to govt
articles.description: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala has said that the government should give an account of the ₹26 lakh crore "accrued" through excise duty on petrol and diesel in about eight years. Notably, Surjewala's comment comes after petrol and diesel prices were hiked five times in the past week. The price hikes have come after a gap of over four months.

articles.title: Father arrested from Bihar in rape case of 11-yr-old Pune girl
articles.description: Days after a rape case of an 11-year-old girl by four members of her family in Pune was reported, her father has been arrested from Bihar. Earlier, the victim's minor brother, grandfather and uncle were detained in the case. The girl's father was produced before a court and has been remanded in police custody till March 31.

articles.title: B'luru Traffic Police sends beggars to Special Rehabilitation Center
articles.description: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Friday sent beggars in an area in the city to the Special Rehabilitation Center. The operation was carried out by the Peenya Traffic Police and its details were shared on social media. Pictures from the day show police officers posing with and talking to the beggars while one of them was seen sitting in an ambulance.

articles.title: 3 drug peddlers transporting ganja detained by Hyderabad Police
articles.description: Hyderabad Police detained three drug peddlers under the PD Act for transporting ganja on Saturday. The men, who are drivers by profession, reportedly purchased 200 kg of the drug at ₹3000/kg from Telangana's Bhadrachalam Agency area and were transporting it to Hyderabad. Officers also recovered a vehicle used in the transportation of drugs and remanded the three into judicial custody.

articles.title: Delhi businessman found hanging inside hotel room in Rajasthan
articles.description: A 40-year-old businessman from Delhi was found hanging from a ceiling fan inside a hotel room in Rajasthan's Bundi on Sunday, police said. No suicide note was found from the room, where he was staying for last three days. The matter came to light when he didn't respond to repeated calls and the manager unlocked the door with another key.

articles.title: Space lettuce could protect astronauts' bones on Mars mission: Study
articles.description: US scientists developed genetically-modified lettuce which could be used by astronauts to avoid bone loss during the three-year-long Mars voyage. The team grew the plant by infusing it with a form of PTH (parathyroid hormone) which is used to negate bone loss. Astronauts can carry plant seeds and grow them in space just like regular lettuce, the team said.

articles.title: 'The Kashmir Files' should be released on YouTube: Baba Ramdev
articles.description: Baba Ramdev has urged the makers of 'The Kashmir Files' to release the film on YouTube so that everyone can learn about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the valley in 1990. Ramdev added that film has earned enough revenue and can be uploaded online. "I don't speak...language of any political party, I speak from...point of view of...people," he added.

articles.title: You'll have never-ending support: Anushka after India's defeat in WC
articles.description: After India were knocked out of the Women's ODI World Cup, actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "You'll always have our never-ending support and belief." "The result did not go our way and was heartbreaking but what an exciting, enthralling match you fought right till the end girls," Anushka wrote. South Africa defeated India by three wickets.

articles.title: 'India has 2 kinds of English', says Bhagat on meeting Tharoor, the MP replies
articles.description: After meeting Congress MP Shashi Tharoor at an event, author Chetan Bhagat shared a picture with him on Twitter and said, "India has two kinds of English. 1. The Shashi Tharoor English. 2. The Chetan Bhagat English." Tharoor replied, "My dear Chetan, it was a pleasure catching up with you (Now how would you say that in Chetan Bhagat English?)"

articles.title: Nearly 30,000 refugees from Ukraine reach France: French minister
articles.description: French Minister Delegate for Housing Emmanuelle Wargon on Sunday said nearly 30,000 refugees from Ukraine have reached France. Wargon added half of the 30,000 refugees will travel through the country to other countries such as Spain. Meanwhile, at least 1,104 civilians, including 96 children, were killed in Ukraine from February 24 to March 25.

articles.title: When I saw Hardik in Baroda, he was bowling around 80%: Nehra
articles.description: Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra said Hardik Pandya was bowling around 80% when he saw the all-rounder in Baroda a few weeks ago. "Since then he went to the NCA and has been practising non-stop," Nehra added. Nehra stated that Hardik has used the word "surprise" a couple of times. "Maybe...he's saying his bowling is a 'surprise'," Nehra added.

articles.title: Spectators given plastic chairs for ₹3,000 IPL match ticket, pics go viral
articles.description: Several pictures have gone viral showing spectators being given plastic chairs for ₹3,000 tickets to watch Delhi Capitals-Mumbai Indians match at Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. "Surely for ₹3,000 ticket prices...spectators should have been given better seats," a fan tweeted. "I think sitting on plastic chairs and that too in this extremely hot weather, is a bit unfair," a spectator tweeted.

articles.title: 'Friendship' transcends death: Amitabh Bachchan in letter to Irrfan's son Babil
articles.description: Late actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil recently took to Instagram to share a letter that actor Amitabh Bachchan wrote to him about his father. "Life is transient and death is unfathomable, but 'Friendship' transcends death," Bachchan wrote. "Your father Irrfan, was a great soul and everyone whose lives he touched, are better for having known him," he added.

articles.title: Armies of India, UAE hold talks in Pune to enhance cooperation
articles.description: The inaugural army to army staff talks (AAST) between the Indian Army and United Arab Emirates (UAE) Army were conducted at the College of Military Engineering in Pune on Friday and Saturday. The focus of the talks was on military exercises and enhancing cooperation between the two armies. The UAE delegation visited the Pune-based National Defence Academy and other places.

articles.title: Harry Kane becomes England's joint second-highest goalscorer
articles.description: After scoring in a 2-1 win over Switzerland, Harry Kane has drawn level with Sir Bobby Charlton's record to become England's joint second-highest goalscorer. Kane achieved the feat after converting a penalty during the international friendly. Kane has now scored 49 goals for his country. He is four goals away from equalling Wayne Rooney's record, who is England's highest goalscorer.

articles.title: Man permanently injured as casino serves chemicals instead of beer; to get ₹61 cr
articles.description: A man who was permanently injured, after he was served cleaning solvents instead of tap beer at a casino bar in 2018, was awarded $8 million (around ₹61 crore) by a Las Vegas jury. The man has stomach and esophageal ulcers and is at increased risk of cancer. He was served chemicals used to clean beer taps and lines.

articles.title: BJP responsible for Mufti's 'dialogue with Pakistan' comment: Raut
articles.description: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut has criticised Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti's demand of BJP holding dialogue with Pakistan if it wants to ensure peace in Kashmir. Raut said BJP was once PDP's "friend" as they were in an alliance and is responsible for Mufti's remarks. PDP has always been "pro-Pakistan" and sympathises with terrorists, Raut alleged.

articles.title: Couple forges Mumbai landlord's signature on rent receipt, booked
articles.description: A couple staying in a rented accommodation in Mumbai's Khar allegedly forged a receipt with their landlord's fake signature to show they paid rent, police said. The accused allegedly signed a rental agreement in August 2020 and paid rent for six months before they started delaying payments. The couple has been booked for cheating and forgery, police added.

articles.title: B'luru Traffic Police finds stolen purse with money, returns to owner
articles.description: A Bengaluru Traffic Police personnel found a stolen purse containing money and returned it to the owner. The stolen item was recovered by an officer of Pulakeshi City Traffic Police Station, who was on duty at Wheeler Road. A picture shared on the force's Twitter handle shows the officer in a high-visibility vest handing over the purse to a man.

articles.title: Why are girls always targeted?: Harnaaz on question on hijab controversy
articles.description: After Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Sandhu was asked about her thoughts on the hijab controversy, the event moderator told the reporter to not ask political questions. Harnaaz then replied, "Honestly, why do you always target girls? Even now you're targeting me...Even on the issue of hijab girls are being targeted. Let them (girls) live the way they choose to."

articles.title: RCB's biggest loss has been Yuzvendra Chahal: Virender Sehwag
articles.description: Talking about RCB not retaining or buying Yuzvendra Chahal for IPL 2022, Virender Sehwag said, "RCB's biggest loss has been Chahal. He was their best player on pitches like in Bengaluru and in Dubai." He added, "He used to take the most wickets on those grounds...If I was part of RCB...I wouldn't have thought about letting Chahal go...for any price."

articles.title: Delhi woman raped, threatened inside night shelter, DCW sends notice
articles.description: The Delhi Commission for Women has sent a notice to the Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board (DUSIB) and Delhi Police after a former caretaker alleged she was raped and threatened at the facility. She further alleged that a 'mentally challenged' resident was also raped by one of the accused. This warrants urgent action, said DCW Chairperson Swati Maliwal.

articles.title: 33-year-old man assaulted near Delhi's Saket metro station; 1 held
articles.description: A man has been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 33-year-old man on Saturday afternoon during a road rage incident near South Delhi's Saket metro station, police said. The incident, during which the victim's turban fell to the ground, took place when the accused persons' car hit the victim's two-wheeler. The accused later ran away while leaving their car behind.

articles.title: Adani Finserve, Tata AIG, 52 other firms bid for Reliance Capital: Reports
articles.description: Adani Finserve, Tata AIG and ICICI Lombard are among 54 prominent companies that have expressed interest to acquire debt-ridden Reliance Capital Limited, PTI reported on Sunday. The company's board was superseded by RBI on November 29 in view of payment defaults and governance issues. The company had said in September 2021 that it had a consolidated debt of ₹40,000 crore.

articles.title: India’s first aluminium metro train flagged off for Pune Metro
articles.description: India's first aluminium-body metro train was flagged off for Maha-Metro's Pune project at an event held at Kolkata on Saturday. According to officials, Titagarh was given the order for the manufacture and supply of 102 metro coaches for the Pune Metro project in 2019. Titagarh will supply three trains from its plant in Italy and the remaining from India.

articles.title: EV switch will create 45,000 jobs in Delhi in next 5 yrs: Sisodia
articles.description: At least 45,000 new jobs will be created as Delhi registers an increasing number of electric vehicles (EVs) in the next five years, said Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia. At least 20,000 jobs around the maintenance, repair of EVs will be created in the next five years and 25,000 jobs will be created through 5,000 permits for e-autos, Sisodia said.

articles.title: FDI in India has broken records every year in last 7 years: Piyush Goyal
articles.description: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said foreign direct investment (FDI) in India in the last seven years "has consistently been growing and has broken all records year after year". He added that this shows India is emerging as a preferred destination for investment. "We had record investments in the COVID-19 period too," he said.

articles.title: 'Pushpa' director pens poem for Rajamouli after watching 'RRR'
articles.description: Filmmaker Sukumar, who directed Allu Arjun-starrer Telugu film 'Pushpa', on Saturday shared a poem on social media appreciating filmmaker SS Rajamouli after watching 'RRR'. He wrote in Telugu, "We have to run to receive you even if you are next to us...Rajamouli sir, the only difference between you and us. You can make a film like this...That is the difference."

articles.title: Delhi Budget innovative & bold, will address unemployment: Kejriwal
articles.description: The Delhi Budget is "innovative and bold" and will address price rise, unemployment by creating two million new jobs in five years, said Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. "In the last seven years, the Delhi government has ensured around 12 lakh job opportunities for the city's young people. Of these, 1,78,000 jobs were created in the government sector," Kejriwal added.

articles.title: Myanmar military won't hold talks with 'terrorists': Junta chief
articles.description: Myanmar junta chief Senior General Min Aung Hlaing said on Sunday that the country's military won't hold talks with opposition "terrorist" forces, vowing to annihilate them "for killing innocent people". The junta accuses opposition forces of killing civilians and security forces amid its resistance campaign against military coup. Myanmar junta overthrew the civilian government in February 2021.

articles.title: 750 cyclists led by BJP's Tejasvi Surya ride 75km from B'luru to Kolar
articles.description: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya led 750 cyclists for a 75-km ride from Bengaluru to Kolar to mark the  Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav on Sunday. "Glad to see the participation of young men and women in large numbers!" Surya said. He also shared a video of the event which was named 'Cycle 2 Freedom'.

articles.title: There are times when I feel lonely: World's richest man Elon Musk
articles.description: World's richest man, Elon Musk, who has a net worth of $256 billion, said, "There are times when I feel lonely...I'm sure there are times when everyone's lonely." He added, "Say if I'm working on the starship rocket...and I'm just staying in my little house by myself, especially if my dog is not with me, then I feel quite lonely."

articles.title: I let go of 'OMG: Oh My God!', get more satisfaction in theatre: Bharat Jadhav
articles.description: Actor Bharat Jadhav said that he gets more satisfaction by doing theatre and that he let go of Akshay Kumar starrer 'OMG: Oh My God!'. "I was offered Mahadev's role...We were supposed to start shooting in December...but after multiple delays...I was asked for dates in April. April is the busy season for theatre. So, I left the movie," he added.

articles.title: India repatriates 3 Pak prisoners after completion of jail terms
articles.description: India on Saturday repatriated three Pakistani nationals after they completed serving their prison sentence, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. They were repatriated via the Attari-Wagah border transit point, it added. Separately, the MEA said that India's efforts have secured the release and repatriation of 20 Indian fishermen and one civilian prisoner from Pakistan's custody in 2022.

articles.title: I think we have quite a serious issue with 'gerontocracy': Elon Musk
articles.description: World's richest person Elon Musk in an interview said, "I think we already have quite a serious issue with gerontocracy, where the leaders of so many countries are extremely old." He added, "In the US, it's a very, very ancient leadership." He also said, "It's impossible to stay in touch with the people if you're many generations older than them."

articles.title: NMMT to run special bus services to DY Patil Stadium during IPL
articles.description: Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) will run special bus services from temporary parking lots at four locations to the Dr DY Patil Stadium bus stop in Nerul during Indian Premier League (IPL) matches. Those arriving by buses or trains will also get services to bus stops near stadium. The stadium will host 20 matches between March 27 and May 18.

articles.title: B'luru airport deploys scanner to check communicable diseases in visitors
articles.description: Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport has deployed Artificial Intelligence and X-ray based real-time scanner to detect communicable diseases among international travellers. "This will go a long way in preventing cross border transmission of communicable diseases," Karnataka Health Minister Sudhakar K said. The technology was tested for four weeks before being launched.

articles.title: Muslims love BJP, Yogi & Modi: Uttar Pradesh MoS Danish Azad Ansari
articles.description: Danish Azad Ansari, who took oath as Minister of State in Yogi Adityanath-led government, said Muslims have understood government has worked for all sects of Muslim community and they love BJP, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "Opinion has changed...schemes for ration, houses, Ayushman card have benefited all sections," he said.

articles.title: Russia's Zvonareva wears cap with 'no war' message at Miami Open
articles.description: Russian tennis player Vera Zvonareva donned a visor cap with a 'no war' message written on it during her third-round match against USA's Danielle Collins at the Miami Open on Saturday. The 37-year-old player, who won bronze at the Beijing Olympics in 2008, came up with the gesture in view of Russia's invasion of Ukraine last month.

articles.title: Understood impact of people coming to stadiums in my career: Kohli
articles.description: Virat Kohli said he has understood the impact and contribution of spectators in the stadiums in his career. "When I look back at it, I fed off 40,000-50,000 people's shouting. It drove me to...different level, where I felt...anything is possible," he added. Talking about the fans allowed in IPL 2022, Kohli said, "Hopefully, we'll get...more of them as...tournament goes on."

articles.title: It should be end of glorious careers of Jhulan, Mithali: Diana Edulji
articles.description: After India Women crashed out of the 2022 Women's ODI World Cup, ex-India captain Diana Edulji said it's time to look at the future. "There are juniors waiting in the wings and it's time we play them...I think it should be the end of the glorious careers of two Indian cricketers, Mithali Raj and Jhulan Goswami," stated Edulji.

articles.title: Oscar nominees to get gift bag worth ₹76 lakh; includes piece of plot in Scotland
articles.description: Oscar nominees for 2022 will be given a gift bag filled with goodies worth more than $100,000 (₹76 lakh). The bag will contain 52 items ranging from cookies to a plot of land in Scotland's Highland Titles. The most expensive item in the gift is a stay at Scotland's Turin Castle. Apart from this, it will contain various skincare products.

articles.title: I am an actor but I charge 'star' rates: Nawazuddin Siddiqui
articles.description: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, speaking at the ABP Summit, stated that he is an actor but charges 'star' rates, adding that while superstars do one film a year, he does five. The actor further said that OTT platforms have now been taken over by stars who have ruined the platforms. "Good things do not sustain in this country," Nawazuddin added.

articles.title: This could be last Test for Root as captain: Michael Vaughan
articles.description: With England having a second-innings lead of just 10 runs with only two wickets remaining against the West Indies, former English skipper Michael Vaughan said that he feels this could be Joe Root's "last Test as captain". "I can just see it in his face. I've been in that position...it might be starting to come to an end," Vaughan said.

articles.title: Russia sowing hatred for itself among Ukrainians: Zelenskyy
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Russia's ongoing military offensive in Ukraine is responsible for growing hatred towards the country among Ukrainians. "You're doing everything so that our people themselves leave...Russian language, because...[it] will now be associated only...with...your crimes," Zelenskyy said in a video address. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

articles.title: Really did not understand that: Akhtar on timing of Dhoni quitting CSK captaincy
articles.description: Talking about the timing of MS Dhoni quitting CSK captaincy, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "Two days before IPL…really did not understand that, to be very honest. He is still the best player in the IPL." He added, "I think he must've been mentally tired. He must have thought of handing someone else the responsibility and playing freely."

articles.title: No agreement between China, Nepal on BRI during bilateral meet
articles.description: China and Nepal did not sign any agreement related to Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) projects during delegation-level talks between the foreign ministers of both countries. "Soft loans for the projects financed under the BRI must not have an interest rate of more than 2%," a Nepalese official said. There was reportedly a disagreement over the timeline of loan repayment.

articles.title: At least 22 ministers of UP govt face criminal charges: ADR report
articles.description: In the newly formed Uttar Pradesh government, at least 22 ministers have declared criminal cases against them, claims the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) report. The poll rights body, which had analysed the self-sworn affidavits of 45 of the total 53 ministers, also claimed that at least 20 (44%) ministers have declared serious criminal cases against themselves.

articles.title: Shah inaugurates Command Centre for citizen services in Chandigarh
articles.description: Aiming to improve citizen services, Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated an Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) in Chandigarh on Sunday. The ICCC has been integrated with citizen services like water, electricity and sewage. "I am confident that Chandigarh, in the days to come, shall become one of the most advanced cities of India and the world," said Shah.

articles.title: Pooja Vastrakar has been most impressive in 2022 Women's WC: Anjum
articles.description: Former India captain Anjum Chopra has said that all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar has "impressed me the most" among all Indian players in the ongoing Women's World Cup. Speaking in an interview with The Quint, Chopra said, "I always felt that she (Vastrakar) is talented...and it's a nice thing...that...she has come good in her first 50-over WC."

articles.title: MI, DC, KKR, CSK will make it to IPL 2022 playoffs: Sunil Gavaskar
articles.description: Talking about the teams that will enter the IPL 2022 playoffs, Sunil Gavaskar said, "Of course Mumbai Indians...Delhi Capitals are the second team." "Kolkata Knight Riders because they are a very...good team...Chennai Super Kings could be the fourth team," Gavaskar added. Ex-Australian opener Matthew Hayden opined that KKR, CSK, DC and Royal Challengers Bangalore will enter the playoffs.

articles.title: Hope Salman uncle tells me I've a role in it: Harshaali on Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2
articles.description: Speaking about the sequel of 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', child actor Harshaali Malhotra said she's excited about the film. "Now, all I hope is Salman (Khan) uncle calls and says...'we need to start preparing for the film', and I'll immediately join him," she added. "I'm waiting for it to start soon, and I hope... I have a role in it," she said.

articles.title: Girls gave it all, I'm proud of them for coming so far: Mithali after defeat in WC
articles.description: After India crashed out of the 2022 Women's World Cup, India captain Mithali Raj said "girls gave it all" and she was proud of the team for their performance in the tournament. "With the bowlers we had, I thought 274 was a good total...it'll take time to settle the emotions," she added. India lost to South Africa by three wickets.

articles.title: PV Sindhu becomes 2nd Indian female badminton player to win Swiss Open
articles.description: PV Sindhu has become the second Indian female badminton player to win Swiss Open title. The 26-year-old defeated Thailand's Busanan Ongbamrungphan 21-16, 21-8 in the final to win her second title of 2022. Saina Nehwal had become the first Indian woman to win Swiss Open in 2011. She also won the title in 2012.

articles.title: Kangana offers 'India's...' contestant to be part of 'Sita- The Incarnation'
articles.description: Kangana Ranaut, who will play Sita in her upcoming film 'Sita- The Incarnation', asked 'India's Got Talent' contestant Ishita Vishwakarma to become the voice of 'Sita' in the movie. Earlier, Ishita was offered a song in the film by show's judge Manoj Muntashir. Now, in an upcoming episode, actress Kangana Ranaut will officially welcome Ishita on board.

articles.title: Brazilian firm offers NFTs to fund preservation of Amazon rainforest
articles.description: Brazilian fundraising firm Nemus has begun selling NFTs to fund preservation of the Amazon rainforest. It said the NFTs will grant buyers unique sponsorship of different sized tracts of forest. Token holders will not own the land itself, but will have access to key information about its preservation, from satellite imagery to licensing, said Nemus' Founder Flavio de Meira Penna.

articles.title: MCG plans to rope in firms to expand charging stations in Gurugram
articles.description: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) plans to involve automobile manufacturing companies to increase the number of charging stations for electric vehicles in the city, local officials said. The companies can use their corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds under this plan to install EV charging stations for the current transitional phase, the MCG Public Relations Officer (PRO) said.

articles.title: Chiranjeevi shares old pic with son Ram Charan on his 37th b'day
articles.description: Veteran actor Chiranjeevi took to Instagram on Sunday to wish his actor-son Ram Charan on his 37th birthday. He shared an old picture where Charan can be seen sitting on his lap. "I find it strange to wish Ram Charan on his birthday through social media. However, on this occasion fans will enjoy some pics," Chiranjeevi wrote.

articles.title: Realised phone was gone as guy next to me jumped from train, leapt after him: Jim
articles.description: Actor Jim Sarbh said that he once jumped from a speeding train to catch person who had stolen his phone in the crowded compartment. "The train starts moving and the...guy...jumps from the train. I check my pocket and the phone is gone...I moved everyone and leapt from the train," Jim said, adding that the person handed over phone to him.

articles.title: Really pleased: England's Heather Knight on qualifying for WC semis
articles.description: England captain Heather Knight, talking about beating Bangladesh in the Women's ODI World Cup, said, "Really pleased, the job was to come here and get the two points and qualify for the semi-finals." England Women defeated Bangladesh by 100 runs in their last group stage match. England will play against South Africa Women in the second semi-final on March 31.

articles.title: Jr NTR throws a birthday bash for his 'RRR' co-star Ram Charan
articles.description: Actor Jr NTR hosted a birthday bash for his 'RRR' co-star Ram Charan on Saturday night at his home. The party was also attended by Akhil Akkineni, among others. Ram Charan turned 37 on March 27. 'RRR', directed by SS Rajamouli, collected ₹223 crore globally on its release day, according to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh.

articles.title: Pramod Sawant to take oath as Goa CM tomorrow; PM to attend event
articles.description: BJP leader Pramod Sawant will take oath as the Chief Minister of Goa for the second term at a ceremony that will be held at 11 am on Monday. PM Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will attend the oath-taking ceremony, a government spokesperson said. More than 10,000 people are expected to attend the event.

articles.title: Sehwag shares pics of Ashwin, Hardik, Bumrah, Deepti's no-balls as India exit Women's WC
articles.description: Following India's 2022 Women's World Cup exit after losing to South Africa, Virender Sehwag compared Deepti Sharma's last over no-ball with that of Ravichandran Ashwin, Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah. Ashwin and Hardik took wickets off no-balls in T20 WC 2016 semi-final loss to West Indies, while Bumrah took wicket off no-ball in India's 2017 CT final loss to Pakistan.

articles.title: 5 of family on way to attend wedding killed in car-truck collision in Maha
articles.description: Five members of a family were killed in a road accident in Maharashtra's Amravati district on Sunday, police said. The deceased were going to Nandgaon Peth to attend a wedding ceremony. The driver of the car they were travelling in tried to overtake a two-wheeler and a speeding truck coming from the opposite direction collided with the car, police added.

articles.title: If 'The Kashmir Files' is getting numbers, it can't be bad: Taapsee
articles.description: Actress Taapsee Pannu in an interview has stated that if a small film like 'The Kashmir Files' is getting numbers at the box office, it can't be a bad film. "Whatever might be the reason, however it happened, the fact is that it happened," she added. Taapsee further said that the intention of people might be questioned but it's subjective.

articles.title: Watch 'The Kashmir..' to know how terror gripped Kashmir under Cong: Shah
articles.description: Home Minister Amit Shah said that people must watch 'The Kashmir Files' to "learn how atrocities and terror gripped Kashmir during Congress rule". "When you made Narendra bhai (PM Modi) Prime Minister for second time, he removed Article 370...people across country realised that if leader with strong willpower like Narendra bhai leads the country, nothing is impossible," he added.

articles.title: Ex-policeman Shinde conspired in Antilia bomb scare case: Court
articles.description: A special National Investigating Agency (NIA) court ruled that former policeman Vinayak Shinde took part in the conspiracy of planting explosives near Antilia, which is industrialist Mukesh Ambani's residence, in Mumbai. The court also added that Shinde, who is serving a life-imprisonment sentence, misused his parole during the conspiracy which took place in February last year.

articles.title: On her way to new home: Shibani rescues dog who was abused in viral Holi video
articles.description: Shibani Dandekar announced through social media on Saturday that she rescued Roxie, the dog, who was abused by its owner in a recent viral Holi video. In the video, the dog's owner was seen incessantly throwing colours on it on Holi. Now, sharing the post, Shibani wrote, "We managed to rescue Roxie and she's on her way to...[her] new home."

articles.title: Sugarcane field catches fire in Uttarakhand, 2 leopard cubs rescued
articles.description: Two leopard cubs were rescued from a sugarcane field that caught fire in Uttarakhand. A wildlife doctor said that three cubs along with their mother got stuck in the field. He added that the mother could escape with one cub, other two cubs were left behind. The cubs have sustained minor burn injuries.

articles.title: Ram Charan thanks fans for RRR's success; says 'I accept this amazing gift'
articles.description: On his birthday, actor Ram Charan took to his Twitter handle on Sunday and expressed gratitude for all the love and appreciation he has been receiving for 'RRR'. He tweeted, "Thank you for the immense love and admiration for...'RRR'. My warmest thanks to each and everyone who has watched the film...with great enthusiasm. I humbly accept this amazing birthday gift."

articles.title: If Kohli opens this IPL season, I'm sure orange cap will be under threat: Shastri
articles.description: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that if Virat Kohli opens for RCB this season then the "orange cap will be under threat". Shastri further said that there's no harm in Kohli batting at the top of the order if RCB have a strong middle order. RCB will play their first game against PBKS on March 27.

articles.title: I'm not afraid of dying, it would come as a relief: World's richest person Musk
articles.description: World's richest person Elon Musk said in an interview he would like to maintain his health for a longer period of time, but he's not afraid of dying. The 50-year-old added, "I think it would come as a relief." He further said he would like to live long enough to see the vision of his aerospace company SpaceX come true.

articles.title: I'll destroy my award if Ukraine President not invited to Oscars: Sean Penn
articles.description: Actor Sean Penn has stated that if Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is not invited to speak at the Oscars, he will publicly destroy his own Oscar. The actor further said that not inviting the President would be "the most obscene moment in all of Hollywood history". Sean further urged people to boycott the ceremony if Zelenskyy is not invited.

articles.title: 23-yr-old burglar arrested in Hyd, valuables worth ₹43 lakh seized
articles.description: A 23-year-old man, who has been accused of several burglary cases, was arrested by Hyderabad's Meerpet Police on Saturday. Valuables worth ₹43 lakh, including gold and silver ornaments, a laptop, and motorcycle were also seized from his possession, police said. The accused, who was released from prison in December 2021, has committed eight thefts this year so far, police added.

articles.title: Kim Kardashian shares boyfriend Pete Davidson's tattoo for her
articles.description: American television personality Kim Kardashian took to Instagram Stories to share her boyfriend comedian Pete Davidson's tattoo for her reading, 'My girl is a lawyer'. The tattoo is placed above Pete's left collar bone. Kim had spoken about this tattoo in an interview earlier month. Kim also passed her baby bar exam in December on her third attempt.

articles.title: 22-yr-old man rapes 2 women aged around 70 on same night in Thane
articles.description: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping two women aged around 70 on the same night in Maharashtra's Thane district, police said on Sunday. Both the women are neighbours. On March 20, the man allegedly broke into the house of a 70-year-old woman and raped her and later he raped her 72-year-old neighbour.

articles.title: UP CM Yogi inaugurates air service from Gorakhpur to Varanasi
articles.description: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath virtually inaugurated the air service from Gorakhpur to Varanasi on Sunday. "At present, 75 destinations can be reached from UP to different states in the country," CM Yogi said. He also added that five years ago, only four airports were functional in the state and travel was possible to 25 destinations in the country.

articles.title: Some Noida areas to get decentralised solid waste management plants
articles.description: Several high-rise societies in some sectors of Noida will form clusters and build common solid waste management plants, according to local authorities and the Noida Federation of Apartment Owners' Associations (NOFAA). The Apartment Owners' Associations (AOA) of Sector 50 will form the first cluster, they added. The building of the plants will be financed by the AOAs of each cluster.

articles.title: Stage gave me my husband, we stepped in for unavailable actors in play: Shweta
articles.description: Actress Shweta Tripathi Sharma said that the best thing that the stage has given her is her husband rapper Chaitanya Sharma. "We were the understudies for a play...Two actors weren't available...both of us had to step in," she said, adding, "In fact, the stage is so important to us that he proposed to me on a stage of Cuckoo Club."

articles.title: Mumbai holds 1st 'Sunday Street' event, people do yoga & cycling
articles.description: Mumbai Police launched 'Sunday Street' initiative in which several people participated in various activities like yoga, cycling and walking. The event will be held every Sunday and some of the roads in Mumbai will remain completely or partially shut for vehicular traffic for four hours between 6 am and 10 am. Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey inaugurated the event.

articles.title: Crude bombs found near football ground in Bengal's Birbhum days after violence
articles.description: Crude bombs were found by police in a plastic bag near a football ground in a village in West Bengal's Birbhum on Sunday. A bomb squad team of Criminal Investigation Department (CID) reportedly reached the spot to defuse these bombs. This comes days after eight persons died after a mob allegedly set around 10-12 houses on fire in Birbhum.

articles.title: PVR & INOX announce merger, combined entity to be called PVR INOX Limited
articles.description: The Board of Directors of PVR Limited and INOX Leisure Limited on Sunday approved an all-stock amalgamation of the two brands. The combined entity will be known as PVR INOX Limited and the share exchange ratio will be three shares of PVR for 10 shares of INOX. The merger is yet to receive approvals from the respective shareholders and SEBI.

articles.title: Lost roles as I was 'too pretty', people said 'can't see you like this': Raashii
articles.description: Actress Raashii Khanna said that she lost roles because people thought she was "too pretty". "There's a certain stereotype...that you can either be glamour doll or a great actor, you can't be both. Some people...rejected me saying, 'You are too pretty...we can't see you like this'. I am like, 'Take my audition and see if I can act!'," she added.

articles.title: Uprooted Shivalinga brought to Chhattisgarh court after temple issued summon
articles.description: An uprooted Shivalinga was brought to a court in Chhattisgarh after revenue officials issued a summon against the Shiva temple complaining of illegal occupation. Fearing a penalty of ₹10,000 that was mentioned in the summon, the caretakers took Shivalinga to court as the notice didn’t mention the name of the owner or any priest. However, the hearing was cancelled.

articles.title: Chhattisgarh man rapes & kills girl, tries to pass it off as suicide
articles.description: A 23-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly raped and strangulated a teenage girl to death in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur, police said on Sunday. The accused also then hung the body from the ceiling at her house and wrote a suicide note to make it look like suicide, Additional SP Harish Rathor said. The deceased was a Class 12 student.

articles.title: Man who murdered Ola Founder's grandmother and aunt gets life sentence
articles.description: A 30-year-old man has been convicted for the murder of Ola Founder Bhavish Aggarwal's grandmother and aunt and sentenced to life imprisonment by a Ludhiana court. Sukhpal Singh was arrested in 2016 after the women were found brutally murdered at their residence in Ludhiana. Singh was the family's driver and had allegedly stolen jewellery and other valuables from the house.

articles.title: Which services are likely to be hit due to Bharat Bandh on March 28 & 29?
articles.description: A joint forum of central trade unions, with support from All India Bank Employees Association, has called for Bharat Bandh on March 28 and 29 against the Central government's policies affecting workers. Workers from roadways, transport, electricity, railways, coal, steel, oil, telecom, insurance and postal sectors are likely to join the strike. SBI said its banking services may get affected.

articles.title: Delhi has become India's EV capital: Manish Sisodia
articles.description: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said Delhi has become India's electric vehicle (EV) capital within 18 months of launch of the Delhi Electric Vehicles Policy 2020. He said the share of EV sales in Delhi has increased from 1.2% in 2019-20 to 10% in February 2022. "We'll issue 5,000 e-auto permits every year for the next five years," Sisodia added.

articles.title: My son Azad was 'least affected' by my divorce with Kiran: Aamir
articles.description: During an interview, Aamir Khan revealed his 10-year-old son Azad was "least affected" by his divorce from his ex-wife Kiran Rao as there wasn't any change in his life due to their separation. "Kiran's parents were disappointed but gradually they understood our relationship," Aamir added. Aamir further said he and Kiran live in the same house but on different floors.

articles.title: My name is Khan and I am told 'Go to Pakistan': Kabir Khan on trolls
articles.description: Filmmaker Kabir Khan at a recent ABP summit discussed social media trolls and said, "My name is Khan and (hence I'm told) 'Go to Pakistan'." He added, "I have been to Pakistan once and Lashkar (a terrorist outfit) said to go back to India, so I am neither here nor there." He also said, "It does feel bad."

articles.title: Shah Rukh to shoot for Salman's 'Tiger 3' in June: Reports
articles.description: Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly make a cameo appearance in Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif-starrer 'Tiger 3'. As per reports, Shah Rukh will shoot for his sequence in June in Mumbai. Salman also shot for a cameo in Shah Rukh's 'Pathaan', wherein he reprised his role as Avinash Singh Rathore from his 'Tiger' franchise. 'Pathaan' will release in January 2023.

articles.title: PM to participate in virtual Grah Pravesh of MP PMAY houses on March 29
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will participate in virtual 'grah pravesh' of houses built in Madhya Pradesh for beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Rural) on March 29. Prime Minister will take part in house-warming function of homes built for 5.21 lakh beneficiaries. Target to provide houses to all homeless families in state under this scheme by 2024 has been set.

articles.title: Swara attends pre-Oscars event on South Asian excellence, shares pics
articles.description: Actress Swara Bhasker on Saturday took to Instagram to share her pictures at the pre-Oscars event celebrating South Asian excellence. She also met Priyanka Chopra, Lilly Singh, Kal Penn and Poorna Jagannathan among others. The actress wrote, "The sense of community and fraternity I witnessed that night was among the most uplifting things I've witnessed in my professional life!"

articles.title: Delhi-Meerut Expressway toll fees likely to be revised from April 1
articles.description: National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has notified revised toll fees for the Delhi-Meerut Expressway which will likely be effective from April 1 onwards, said NHAI Project Director Arvind Kumar. The toll fees for cars and jeeps will be hiked from ₹140 to ₹155. Travelling from Sarai Kale Khan to Ghaziabad's Dasna will be free for now, he added.

articles.title: There's always tension when MS Dhoni is batting: Shreyas Iyer
articles.description: Talking about CSK scoring 47 runs in their last three overs against KKR in IPL 2022 opener, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said, "There's always tension when MS Dhoni is batting." "I knew momentum is going to shift towards them because it wasn't easy for...bowlers to grip the ball," he added. Dhoni slammed a fifty as CSK scored 131/5.

articles.title: Will never get over this moment: Halle Berry recalls winning Oscar in 2002
articles.description: American actress Halle Berry took to Twitter and shared a 20-year-old picture showing her posing with an Oscar statue. The actress won the Oscar in 2002 in Best Actress in a Leading Role category for her performance in 'Monster's Ball'. "20 years ago, this week, I walked through that door. I will never get over this moment," Halle wrote.

articles.title: Delhi Capitals, Mumbai Indians announce their playing XIs for IPL 2022 clash
articles.description: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Mumbai Indians (MI) in their IPL 2022 clash at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. DC and MI have played 30 matches against each other in IPL, with MI winning 16 and DC winning 14. DC are playing two foreign players in their playing XI.

articles.title: Rachakonda Police bust prostitution ring, arrest 35-yr-old offender
articles.description: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police invoked the Preventive Detention (PD) Act on Saturday against a 35-year-old human trafficking offender for allegedly running a prostitution racket in the city's Gokhale Nagar area. The accused, Basavi Raja Teja, was arrested following a raid last month. One woman, who hailed from Telangana's Jangaon district, was also rescued from premises during the raid.

articles.title: CBI to interact with those injured in violence in Bengal's Birbhum
articles.description: The CBI probing the Birbhum killings in West Bengal will on Sunday interact with people injured in the violence, an official said. CBI officers will also talk to local people in connection with the probe. At least eight people, including children, were killed after miscreants allegedly set around 10-12 houses on fire in Birbhum's Bogtui village on March 21.

articles.title: Manipur announces 5-day work week for all govt offices, agencies from April 1
articles.description: The Manipur government has declared a five-day work week from Monday to Friday for all offices, agencies, bodies and public sector undertakings (PSU) under the state government, excluding vacation departments, with effect from April 1. "Further, school hours will start at 8 am in all state government/aided/private schools across the state from Monday to Saturday," an official notification stated.

articles.title: Sanctions can be lifted if Russia ends Ukraine war: UK
articles.description: The UK has said the sanctions imposed against Russia could be lifted if it ends its military operation in Ukraine. "Those sanctions should only come off with a full ceasefire and withdrawal, but also commitments that there will be no further aggression," said British Foreign Minister Liz Truss. There could be "snapback sanctions" in case of future aggression, she added.

articles.title: Buildings damaged as 5.8-magnitude earthquake hits Ecuador coast
articles.description: An earthquake of magnitude 5.8 hit Ecuador's coastline on Saturday night, causing damage to buildings and light poles on highways. European Mediterranean Seismological Centre said that the earthquake's epicentre was 9 km south-southeast of Esmeraldas and was at a depth of 40 km. Multiple videos and pictures of the earthquake have been shared online.

articles.title: PCMC seals 453 properties for tax default in Pimpri-Chinchwad
articles.description: The tax department of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has sealed 453 properties of tax defaulters till March 26 (Saturday), officials said. They said a cellphone tower company owes ₹5 crore in property tax and it is the highest amount due. The department collected ₹483 crore in property tax, the officials added.

articles.title: Who will play whom in 2022 Women's World Cup semi-finals?
articles.description: Australia topped the 2022 Women's World Cup group stage, while South Africa finished second. England came third and West Indies finished fourth. Australia will face West Indies in the first semi-final on March 30 (Wednesday). South Africa will face England in the second semi-final on March 31 (Thursday). West Indies qualified for semi-finals for the second time in tournament history.

articles.title: Nelson Mandela's original arrest warrant from 1961 sells as NFT for $130,000
articles.description: An NFT (non-fungible token) of Nelson Mandela's original arrest warrant from 1961 was auctioned for 1.9 million rand ($130,000). Mandela, an anti-apartheid activist and South Africa's first Black president, was arrested for conspiring to overthrow White-minority government. The buyer of the NFT will have exclusive access to the original document at South Africa's Liliesleaf Museum Heritage Site.

articles.title: Who is the youngest and the oldest actor to win Oscar?
articles.description: Tatum O'Neal became the youngest-ever actor to win an Oscar after being named 'Best Supporting Actress' aged 10 years and 106 days at 46th Academy Awards in 1974. Tatum won Oscar for 'Paper Moon'. Anthony Hopkins became the oldest actor to win Oscar after bagging 'Best Actor' Oscar for 'The Father' in 2021 aged 83 years and 115 days.

articles.title: Let's make the local 'global': PM Modi on Indian exports
articles.description: PM Narendra Modi in his 'Mann Ki Baat' radio programme on Sunday lauded India's achievement of the target of $400 billion in exports in FY2022. The PM said, "Let's make the local 'global' and augment the prestige of our products further." He added, "When every Indian is vocal for local, it doesn't take long for the local to become global."

articles.title: Car is dead but we're fine, thanks Musk: Man on pic of Tesla after accident
articles.description: A man named Paul Kelly took to Twitter to share a picture of his Tesla car that met with an accident, and his tweet has since gone viral. Kelly, who is from Ireland according to his Twitter bio, wrote, "Thank you Elon Musk and Tesla for keeping my family safe." He added, "The car is dead. We are fine."

articles.title: Cong alleges corruption in Amtek insolvency; demands CBI probe
articles.description: Congress on Sunday alleged that Centre was protecting the promoters of Amtek Group which has declared insolvency and demanded a CBI probe into it. The party said that the group took a loan of ₹21,000 crore from banks and then put it on sale for ₹4,100 crore. Congress leader Pawan Khera said that institutional corruption is going on.

articles.title: It was a smart decision to play Umesh Yadav: Kaif on Iyer's captaincy
articles.description: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has praised KKR captain Shreyas Iyer, stating that it was a smart decision to include pacer Umesh Yadav in the playing XI. "Shreyas played Shivam Mavi as well and utilised the spinners (Varun Chakravarthy and Sunil Narine) and Andre Russell adeptly," Kaif added. Umesh conceded 12 runs and picked two wickets during the powerplay.

articles.title: People said 'I'd be pretty if I was light-skinned': Bridgerton actor Charithra
articles.description:
Charithra Chandran spoke about how colourism affected her life. "I remember strangers saying, 
'You'd be pretty if you were light-skinned like your grandmother'," she said. "[They were] trying to blame my granddad for giving me my skin colour," she added. "I've even had friends say to me, 'Oh you got [success] because you're brown' and that really hurts," Charithra said.

articles.title: Would pick Virat Kohli if I had to cast cricketer in 'Brahmastra': Ayan
articles.description: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji said that if he had to choose a cricketer for the film, he would choose Virat Kohli. "All my answers related to cricket are always about Virat Kohli. Brahmastra needs a true superstar spirit, so I would cast Virat Kohli," he said. Actress Alia Bhatt and actor Amitabh Bachchan will also be seen in 'Brahmastra'.

articles.title: India tests medium-range surface-to-air missile, destroys target in direct hit
articles.description: India on Sunday successfully test-fired the medium-range surface-to-air missile air defence system off the coast of Odisha’s Balasore, said DRDO. The air defence system is a part of the Army. The DRDO officials also said that the target was destroyed by the missile in a direct hit. This comes after India successfully test-fired surface-to-surface BrahMos supersonic cruise missile on Wednesday.

articles.title: Businessman arrested for abetting 35-yr-old maid's suicide in Mumbai
articles.description: A businessman from Mumbai's Bandra was arrested on charges of abetment of suicide of his 35-year-old maid. The businessman's wife has also been booked in this connection. According to the FIR, the maid, who was debt-ridden, was asked to stop working as she was unable to work as per expectations. The maid was very depressed, the FIR further stated.

articles.title: Entirely predictable: Tharoor as fuel prices hiked for 5th time
articles.description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday reacted to the hike in petrol and diesel prices for the fifth time in six days, saying, "This was entirely predictable!" The price of petrol has been increased by 50 paise/litre, while that of diesel is by 55 paise/litre. "Tax-gouging and price manipulation have been...hallmarks of this government’s contempt for...common citizen," he added.

articles.title: Marvel Studios' 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' filming wrapped
articles.description: The makers of 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' have wrapped the filming. Multiple crew members, including hairstylist Nikki Wright, confirmed the news on Instagram. Nikki shared a picture from Puerto Rico on her Instagram handle and wrote, "That's a wrap #blackpanther2." Directed by Ryan Coogler, the film is set to release in theatres on November 11.

articles.title: India crash out of 2022 Women's World Cup in group stage after losing to SA on last ball
articles.description: India have crashed out of the 2022 Women's World Cup after losing to South Africa on the last ball in their last group stage match. India failed to qualify for the semi-finals after finishing fifth on the group stage points table with four defeats in seven matches. Australia, South Africa, England and West Indies have reached the semi-finals.

articles.title: Army trains specially-abled youth in skiing, NGO provides accessories
articles.description: Six Kashmiri youths were given skiing training at the High-Altitude Warfare School in Gulmarg. "Artificial limbs and other special accessories were provided by the Bhagwan Mahaveer Viklang Sahayata Samiti, an NGO from Jaipur," Army spokesman Emron Musavi said. Meanwhile, army officials reportedly termed the event "historic". The team was led by Lt Col Dharamdatt Goel, who is himself an amputee.

articles.title: Users tweet videos of some McDonald's outlets still open in Russia
articles.description: Several locals and news reports have claimed that some of the McDonald’s outlets are still operational in Russia. On March 8, McDonald's had announced that it would temporarily close its 850 outlets in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. Some Russians also took to social media to share videos of the operational outlets. McDonald's hasn't commented on this as yet.

articles.title: I have hair-pulling disorder, carried shame for so long: Amy Schumer
articles.description: Actress-comedienne Amy Schumer has revealed that she has a hair-pulling disorder called trichotillomania, adding that she has carried shame about it for a long time. Amy further said that she once pulled out so much of her own hair that she needed to wear an ill-fitting wig to school. "It's still something that I struggle with," she added.

articles.title: He made a film from his perspective: Nawazuddin on Vivek's The Kashmir Files
articles.description: Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he's yet to watch Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', but will definitely watch it. Responding to whether the film was being opposed to by a certain section of Bollywood, he said, "I've no idea...Vivek made a film from his point of view." "It should be allowed for any filmmaker to add their own perspective," he added.

articles.title: Shanaya, Siddhant walk the ramp for Manish Malhotra at Lakme Fashion Week
articles.description: Shanaya Kapoor and Siddhant Chaturvedi turned showstoppers for designer Manish Malhotra, who showcased his latest collection Diffuse on day three of the FDCI x Lakme Fashion Week in Delhi. Shanaya walked the ramp in a purple-pink shimmery backless dress with a high slit. Siddhant wore a long coat featuring geometric designs and paired it with a black button-down shirt.

articles.title: Made history: Maldives Min to Jaishankar on talks held outside Male
articles.description: Maldives Foreign Minister Abdulla Shahid on Saturday tweeted that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar "made history" after official talks were held outside the country's capital city Male for the first time. He added that Maldives welcomes India's "Neighborhood First Policy" and remains committed to their "India First Policy". "Our relationship...has stood the test of time," he further said.

articles.title: Twin born in intact amniotic sac in rare event in Spain, pics surface
articles.description: A second twin baby was born inside an intact amniotic sac in Spain, which is considered one-in-80,000 birth. Known as the veiled birth or 'mermaid' birth, it is when the baby comes out still inside the intact amniotic sac, which otherwise ruptures when the expectant mother goes into labour. The gynaecologist in the procedure shared images of the babies.

articles.title: TDP, Cong call for 'financial emergency' in YSRCP-ruled Andhra
articles.description: The Telugu Desam Party and Congress have asked the Centre to clamp "financial emergency" in Andhra Pradesh due to the alleged mishandling by the YSRCP regime. "Centre should... impose financial emergency under Article 360," said TDP's Yanamala Rama Krishnudu. He further questioned by referring to the financial transactions through 'special bills' that "into whose pockets have ₹48,284 crore gone".

articles.title: Ravindra Jadeja looked a bit nervous vs KKR: Mohammad Kaif
articles.description: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif has said that CSK's newly-appointed captain Ravindra Jadeja looked a bit nervous against KKR. "Maybe there was a bit of pressure of captaincy on him. He couldn't bat freely, he came into bowling late. He seemed a bit conservative. But, it was his first match, he will learn," Kaif stated. KKR defeated CSK by six wickets.

articles.title: 177 arms licences cancelled in 2021, reveals Delhi Police data
articles.description: The figures provided by the licencing department of Delhi Police reveals that 177 arms licences were not renewed in 2021 which is more than twice the figure (83) of 2020. The data also reveals that fresh arms licences were issued to 101 residents in 2021 while in 2020, the figure was recorded at 468.

articles.title: 19-yr-old youth shot dead after fight breaks out among students outside Delhi school
articles.description: A 19-year-old youth was shot dead after a fight broke out between two groups of students outside a school in Delhi's Dwarka, police said. So far, three persons have been arrested and a country-made pistol, along with an empty cartridge, has also been seized from one of them. The incident took place outside Akshay Public School in Kakrola village.

articles.title: Woman loses bag in Mumbai, police trace and return it within 2 hours
articles.description: Mumbai Police on Saturday traced and returned a woman's bag after she lost her bag in an auto-rickshaw near GM Patel College in Goregaon West. "Police personnel from Goregaon traffic chowki traced the auto number with the help of CCTV footage and returned the bag within 2 hours," Mumbai Police wrote on Twitter.

articles.title: J'khand CM replies after tribal boy says he couldn't give school exam
articles.description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Saturday asked authorities to conduct an inquiry following a video appeal by a Class 12 tribal student who claimed that he wasn't able to give his school exam because he didn't get an admit card. "I'd worked hard to give...fees of ₹770 but that didn't help. My one year has been wasted," the boy said.

articles.title: I was body conscious, looked in mirror and said 'No': Vidya on 'The Dirty...'
articles.description: Actress Vidya Balan said that she was body-conscious while shooting for the film 'The Dirty Picture'. She said that she is not someone who wears short dresses and wouldn't wear sleeveless clothes. "Choreographer [of song Ooh La La] wanted me to do pelvic thrusts and heaving of bust and I would look in mirror and be like 'No'," Vidya added.

articles.title: Inflation begins after elections are over: Congress' Digvijaya Singh
articles.description: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh criticised at the Central government over the rising prices of petrol and diesel. The former Madhya Pradesh CM said, "Inflation starts after the elections are over. If elections come again, then the government will come again to control the prices." He also added that "people of the whole country are being cheated".

articles.title: You should take my name: Jay Mala to reporter introducing her with husband's name
