articles.description: A video has surfaced online wherein advocate and journalist Jay Mala asked a reporter to call her by her name rather than introducing her by her husband's name. While the reporter said that not many people know her, Mala said, "Even more important that you take my name…I am an advocate and journalist and have won at least 600 cases."

articles.title: Indian restaurant in Bahrain shut for refusing entry to veiled woman
articles.description: An Indian restaurant in Bahrain's Adliya was reportedly shut by the authorities after it refused entry to a veiled woman. The restaurant apologised for the episode and sacked the errant manager after a video of the incident went viral on social media. The Bahrain tourism body has warned outlets against violating the laws of the kingdom.

articles.title: Not for Biden to decide whether Putin stays in power: Russia
articles.description: Russia has said that it was not for US President Joe Biden to decide whether President Vladimir Putin can stay in power. "The president of Russia is elected by Russians," said Kremlin. This comes after Biden said Putin "cannot remain in power" during his Poland visit. Notably, the White House clarified that Biden was not calling for a "regime change".

articles.title: England defeat B'desh to qualify for semi-finals of Women's WC 2022
articles.description: England defeated Bangladesh by 100 runs to become the third team after Australia and South Africa to secure their place in the semi-finals of the Women's World Cup 2022. Sophia Dunkley's 72-ball 67 helped England post 234/6 and then Sophie Ecclestone's spell of 3/15 helped the defending champions restrict Bangladesh to 134/10. This was England's fourth win in a row.

articles.title: RCB fan gives his vintage car a makeover to express love for team, pic surfaces
articles.description: An RCB fan named Santhosh Sadguru gave his vintage car a makeover to express his love for the team. The fan has got tagline 'Ee Sala Cup Namde’ (this year the cup is ours), along with the letters 'RCB', emblazoned on both sides of his vintage Fiat car. Last year, the fan had given his Bajaj scooter an RCB-themed makeover.

articles.title: Ram Charan's wife Upasana cheers for him while watching RRR, video goes viral
articles.description: Recently, a video of Ram Charan's wife, Upasana Kamineni watching 'RRR' in theatre is going viral on social media. In the video, Upasana can be seen cheering for her husband amid all the whistling and dancing in the theatre, where the audience can be seen flinging random notes. Taking to the comments sections, one user wrote, "The craze is mind-blowing."

articles.title: Please wear a helmet when you are keeping to spinners: Yuvraj requests KKR's Jackson
articles.description: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to request KKR wicketkeeper Sheldon Jackson to wear a helmet while keeping to spinners. "You are a very talented player and have a golden opportunity after a long time...Be safe," Yuvraj tweeted after seeing Jackson keeping to spinners against CSK without wearing a helmet. Jackson was playing an IPL match after five years.

articles.title: 396 kg of marijuana seized in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun, 2 arrested
articles.description: The special task force (STF) of Uttar Pradesh Police has allegedly busted a nexus of drug smugglers and seized over 396 kilogram of marijuana. Two persons have been arrested in this connection in Budaun. Police said the nexus was spread across different states, including Odisha and Andhra Pradesh.

articles.title: I was overworked & stressed: Nargis on taking a break from acting
articles.description: Sharing the reason behind taking a break from films, Nargis Fakhri said, "I realised...I was overworked and stressed." "I remember 2016-2017 was a period of realisation for me," she said, adding, "I felt...I wasn't doing things that made me happy...I did films back-to-back and thought there was...too much happening...I felt the need to pause to balance my mind and body."

articles.title: India resumes regular international flights after a gap of 2 years
articles.description: After a COVID-19 induced gap of two years, India on Sunday resumed international flights. As per the DGCA, as many as 60 airlines from 40 countries have been permitted to operate 1,783 frequencies to/from India during the Summer Schedule. Cabin crew members will no longer need to wear PPE kits and international flights can operate at 100% capacity.

articles.title: $400 billion exports record signifies India's potential, capabilities: PM Modi
articles.description: During his 'Mann Ki Baat' address, PM Narendra Modi said India achieving its $400 billion exports target shows the demand for its items is increasing across the world. The PM added that the achievement signifies India's capabilities and potential. "When each and every Indian is vocal for local, it doesn't take long for the local to become global," he said.

articles.title: Snoop Dogg to collaborate with BTS for a song
articles.description: American rapper Snoop Dogg is set to collaborate with South Korean K-Pop band BTS for a song. Snoop Dogg confirmed the news to The A.V. Club, saying, "It's official like a referee with a whistle." "I make good music. They make good music. And we end up doing this...This is what it's always about, bringing our worlds together," he added.

articles.title: Ban madrasas, they'll never say Bharat Mata ki jai: K'taka BJP MLA
articles.description: Karnataka BJP MLA MP Renukacharya on Saturday urged the state CM and Education Minister to ban madrasas, saying, "They will go against our country and they will never say Bharat Mata ki jai." He added that madrasas "teach anti-national lessons". Furthermore, he criticised Congress' call for a Karnataka bandh over hijab controversy, saying, "Is this Pakistan, Bangladesh, or Islamic country?"

articles.title: 2 labourers injured as span of bridge collapses during construction in Guj
articles.description: Two labourers sustained injuries while working at the Sindhrot water project in Gujarat's Vadodara when a span of a bridge, which was being erected to carry a pipeline, collapsed, a civic official said. The injured labourers were admitted to a hospital for treatment. The work was in its final stages when the fifth span collapsed during construction, the official added.

articles.title: 'Din..' didn't catch up until it was played at Virat-Anushka's wedding: Jasleen
articles.description: Singer Jasleen Royal said that her song 'Din Shagna Da'  was released twice but did not catch up until it was played at Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's wedding. She also said that before she started composing song 'Ranjha' for the film 'Shershaah', someone made a nasty comment about her music which egged her to come up with something great.

articles.title: Need 1% of NATO's planes & tanks, been waiting 31 days: Zelenskyy
articles.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday questioned if Western Nations are afraid of Russia and said that the country "just needed 1% of NATO's aircraft and 1% of its tanks and would not ask for more". "We've already been waiting 31 days," he added. He further said that the aircraft and tanks were "just gathering dust there".

articles.title: Rape case against son fake, it's political plot: Cong MLA Johari
articles.description: Congress MLA Johari Lal Meena said that the rape case against his son is "fake and baseless". "[It is] a political conspiracy after seeing my popularity," he added. Johari's son and two others were booked for allegedly gang-raping a minor girl. "We will take stern action...irrespective of who the accused may be," Congress chief spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said.

articles.title: Dhoni is my inspiration, whatever he does, I try to imitate: Sheldon Jackson
articles.description: Speaking at the post-match presentation after their win against CSK, KKR wicketkeeper-batter Sheldon Jackson said MS Dhoni has always been his inspiration. "Whatever Dhoni does, I just try to imitate it and I have a lot to look and a lot to learn from him," he stated. Sheldon is receiving praise for his stumping of Robin Uthappa in the match.

articles.title: Who are the oldest players to score a fifty in IPL?
articles.description: CSK's MS Dhoni became the oldest Indian and overall the third-oldest cricketer to score a fifty in IPL after scoring 50*(38) aged 40 years and 262 days, against KKR in IPL 2022. Adam Gilchrist is the oldest cricketer to hit an IPL fifty. He was aged 41 years and 181 days when he hit a fifty against RCB in 2013.

articles.title: Woman beggar abducted, beaten up and raped by auto driver, his friend in Delhi
articles.description: A 35-year-old woman beggar was allegedly abducted, beaten up and raped by an auto-rickshaw driver and his friend in Delhi's Ghazipur, police said. A notice by Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has revealed that the woman was operated upon for severe injuries on her private parts. Five teams have been formed and investigation has begun in the case, police added.

articles.title: Biden to propose new 'billionaire's tax' in 2023 budget plan: Reports
articles.description: US President Joe Biden is set to propose a tax aimed at billionaires as a part of his 2023 budget plans, claim several reports. The 'Billionaire Minimum Income Tax' would impose a minimum tax of 20% on those whose income is more than $100 million. Biden’s new tax could reportedly raise up to $360 billion in over 10 years.

articles.title: Salman is the real tiger, I'm like a cub in front of him: Tiger Shroff
articles.description: Speaking about actor Salman Khan, Tiger Shroff said, "Even though my film is taking centre stage on Eid this year, there's only one real Tiger...I'm...a cub in front of him." Tiger added he's lucky that 'Heropanti 2' is releasing on Eid. "Credit goes to Sajid sir. It was his decision to release 'Heropanti 2' on this given occasion," he added.

articles.title: MP locals rush for anti-rabies injection after dog bite kills buffalo
articles.description: Locals in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior reportedly rushed to get anti-rabies injections after they consumed food made from the milk of a buffalo that allegedly died of a dog bite. The buffalo allegedly died three days after a rabid dog bit it. "There was panic and huge crowd gathered outside hospitals...around 40 took the anti-rabies vaccine," Gwalior Chief Medical Officer said.

articles.title: 1 killed, another injured as masked gunman opens fire in US mall
articles.description: A man was killed and a teenage girl injured after a masked gunman opened fire in a shopping mall in US' Chicago. The police called it a targeted attack, however, did not release the motive behind the shooting. The perpetrator fled the scene in a car which was later stopped by the police. The car's owner was taken into custody.

articles.title: Russians living in Prague hold anti-war protest against Putin
articles.description: Thousands of Russians in Czech Republic's Prague on Saturday protested against Russian President Vladimir Putin over the ongoing war in Ukraine. Banners labelling Putin as a killer and asking Russians to "raise their voice and fight the real enemy, not Ukraine" were put up. "Just because we are Russians doesn't mean we are automatically for the war," said a protester.

articles.title: 14 police officers awarded for excellent security during PM's Punjab visit
articles.description: Fourteen Punjab Police officers have been awarded the 'DGP Commendation Disc' for their role in ensuring "excellent" security arrangements without any lapses during PM Narendra Modi's visit to Jalandhar during the recently-held Assembly elections in February. This comes after the state police were earlier criticised following a security breach during PM Modi's visit to Ferozepur in January.
